intro: Tetragonia expansa var. cornuta, commonly known as the horned spinach, is a perennial plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, curled, horn-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant is an edible leafy green, often cultivated for its nutritional value and mild, spinach-like flavor. It thrives in arid and semi-arid climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Tetragonia expansa var. cornuta is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its unique foliage structure.
